title.narrative: Shelter and Settlements response to Hurricane Maria in Dominica

description.narrative: Hurricane Maria affected 100 % of Dominica's population of 73,000 residents, leaving thousands of homes completed destroyed and the island's infrastructure in shambles. With this proposal, Habitat for Humanity is planning to support the shelter recover and reconstruction efforts by providing technical assistance to the Government of Dominica's Ministry of Housing. At the field level, the focus will be on ensuring building quality and safety while supporting the scale up of recovery activities. The project will last nine months, from March to November 2018 and will target 1, 650 people as direct beneficiaries, providing technical training to builders, community assessment teams and government representatives. 265 families will also benefit from financial assistance as incentive for utilizing safe building materials.
